Pre-Game Insights: Memphis Grizzlies finished the 2023-24 season with a 27-55 overall record and 14-37 in Western Conference games, shooting 43.5% from the field and 34.6% from three-point range.

Los Angeles Lakers finished the 2023-24 season with a 47-35 overall record and 27-25 in Western Conference games, averaging 118.0 points per game while shooting 49.9% from the field and 37.7% from three-point range.

Memphis Grizzlies have several key players injured, including John Konchar (day to day with a quad), Desmond Bane (out with an oblique), Luke Kennard (day to day with a foot), Vince Williams Jr. (out with a leg), Marcus Smart (out with an ankle), and GG Jackson II (out with a foot).
Los Angeles Lakers have key players injured as well, with Jarred Vanderbilt (out with a foot) and Christian Wood (out with a knee) sidelined.
